subject: RE: [junit] How to write a Mock Class for a 3rd party class where	 the contructor are private
msgSnippet: One problem of course, is that if you have to make a Mock object for a *class*, not an interface, and the constructors of that class are private, then
messageBody:
One problem of course, is that if you have to make a Mock object for a
*class*, not an interface, and the constructors of that class are private,
then effectively you can't subclass the class (you can't call it's default
constructor).

You'd have to rewrite your code to hide that class behind an interface; have
a 'normal' implementation of that interface which delegates to the class
with private constructors and a 'mock' implementation of that interface
which implements the mockup.

Well actually you can leave out the interface, just hide the real class
behind a facade which delegates to the real class; and for the mockup
inherit from the facade and override all methods to do your mockup thing. I
just find it cleaner to have an interface :-)

regards,

--Tim
